1.text: And Israel took his journey with all that he had, and came to Beer-sheba; and he offered sacrifices to the God of his father Isaac.

2.text: And God spoke to Israel in the visions of the night and said, Jacob, Jacob! And he said, Here am I.

3.text: And he said, I am God, the God of thy father: fear not to go down to Egypt; for I will there make of thee a great nation.

4.text: I will go down with thee to Egypt, and I will also certainly bring thee up; and Joseph shall put his hand on thine eyes.

5.text: And Jacob rose up from Beer-sheba; and the sons of Israel carried Jacob their father, and their little ones, and their wives, on the waggons that Pharaoh had sent to carry him.

6.text: And they took their cattle, and their goods which they had acquired in the land of Canaan, and came to Egypt, Jacob and all his seed with him;

7.text: his sons and his sons’ sons with him, his daughters and his sons’ daughters and all his seed he brought with him to Egypt.

8.text: And these are the names of the sons of Israel who came into Egypt: Jacob and his sons. Jacob’s firstborn, Reuben.

9.text: And the sons of Reuben: Enoch, and Phallu, and Hezron, and Carmi.

10.text: And the sons of Simeon: Jemuel, And Jamin, And Ohad, And Jachin, And Zohar, And Saul the son of a Canaanitish woman.

11.text: And the sons of Levi: Gershon, Kohath, And Merari.

12.text: —And the sons of Judah: Er, and Onan, and Shelah, and Pherez, and Zerah; but Er and Onan died in the land of Canaan. And the sons of Pherez were Hezron and Hamul.

13.text: And the sons of Issachar: Tola, And Puah, And Job, And Shimron.

14.text: And the sons of Zebulun: Sered, And Elon, And Jahleel.

15.text: —These are the sons of Leah, whom she bore to Jacob in Padan-Aram; and his daughter, Dinah. All the souls of his sons and his daughters were thirty-three.

16.text: And the sons of Gad: Ziphion and Haggi, Shuni and Ezbon, Eri, and Arodi, and Areli.

17.text: —And the sons of Asher: Jimnah, and Jishvah, and Jishvi, and Beriah; and Serah their sister; and the sons of Beriah: Heber and Malchiel.

18.text: —These are the sons of Zilpah, whom Laban gave to Leah his daughter; and she bore these to Jacob: sixteen souls.

19.text: The sons of Rachel Jacob’s wife: Joseph and Benjamin.

20.text: And to Joseph in the land of Egypt were born Manasseh and Ephraim, whom Asnath bore to him, the daughter of Potipherah the priest in On.

21.text: And the sons of Benjamin: Belah, And Becher, And Ashbel, Gera And Naaman, Ehi And Rosh, Muppim, And Huppim, And Ard.

22.text: these are the sons of Rachel who were born to Jacob: all the souls were fourteen.

23.text: And the sons of Dan: Hushim.

24.text: And the sons of Naphtali: Jahzeel, And Guni, And Jezer, And Shillem.

25.text: —These are the sons of Bilhah, whom Laban gave to Rachel his daughter; and she bore these to Jacob: all the souls were seven.

26.text: All the souls that came with Jacob to Egypt, that had come out of his loins, besides Jacob’s sons’ wives: all the souls were sixty-six.

27.text: And the sons of Joseph who were born to him in Egypt, were two souls. All the souls of the house of Jacob that came to Egypt were seventy.

28.text: And he sent Judah before him to Joseph, to give notice before he came to Goshen. And they came into the land of Goshen.

29.text: Then Joseph yoked his chariot, and went up to meet Israel his father, to Goshen, and he presented himself to him; and he fell on his neck, and wept on his neck a good while.

30.text: And Israel said to Joseph, Now let me die, after I have seen thy face, since thou still livest.

31.text: And Joseph said to his brethren and to his father’s house, I will go up, and tell Pharaoh, and say to him, My brethren and my father’s house, who were in the land of Canaan, are come to me;

32.text: and the men are shepherds, for they have been occupied with cattle; and they have brought their sheep, and their cattle, and all that they have.

33.text: And it shall come to pass that when Pharaoh shall call you and say, What is your occupation?

34.text: then ye shall say, Thy servants are men that have been occupied with cattle from our youth even until now, both we and our fathers; in order that ye may dwell in the land of Goshen; for every shepherd is an abomination to the Egyptians.
